sentences: Ariadna Thalía Sodi Miranda Mottola (Spanish pronunciation: [aˈɾjaðna taˈli.a ˈsoði miˈɾanda]; born 26 August 1971), known mononymously as Thalía, is a Mexican singer and actress.

She has received numerous accolades, including five Billboard Latin Music Awards, eight Lo Nuestro Awards, as well as seven Latin Grammy Award nominations and their special "President's Merit Award" in 2019.
Considered a Latin pop icon, Ocean Drive called Thalía as "the biggest star Mexico has exported in the last decades".
She was included in Billboards Greatest Latin Artists of All Time in 2020.
On 5 December 2013, she was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame as a recognition for her achievements in the music industry.
During her career, Thalía has been involved in humanitarian causes and is an UNICEF Mexico Ambassador since 2016.
Thalía was born on 26 August 1971 in Mexico City.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She is the youngest of five daughters of Yolanda Miranda Mange (d. 2011), a painter who was Thalía's manager from 1980 to 1999 and Ernesto Sodi Pallares (d. 1977), a scientist, doctor of pathology, criminologist and writer.
